required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Satisfaction With Remifentanil Analgesia in Parturients During the Childbirth
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Satisfaction With Remifentanil Analgesia in Parturients During the Childbirth: Retrospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective observational study to determine the efficacy of remifentanil during the delivery. Authors will search the data in period between 2010 and 2014 in cohort of 100 parturients and obtain data of analgesic efficacy (VAS score after remifentanil analgesia induction) and parturients satisfaction with the method.

detailed_description.textblock:
In retrospective observational study will authors search the documentation of parturients. The cohort size is estimated to 100 subjects, in period between 2010-2014. Excluded will be all patients who did not signed the informed consent for processing with their medical data.The main aim is to evaluate the efficacy of the remifentanil analgesia in parturients in the first phase of delivery.
The analgesic efficacy will be evaluated by the change in VAS (visual analogue scale) score after induction of remifentanil analgesia Satisfaction will be evaluated by the questionary.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of remifentanyl analgesia during the delivery
primary_outcome.time_frame: VAS score before the induction of remifentanyl infusion and 1hour after initiation of remifentanil analgesia during the first phase of delivery
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of remifentanil analgesia during the first phase of delivery in parturients by observing changes in VAS score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before initiation of anagetic method (first phase of delivery) and 1hour after childbirth
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will fill the questionaire to obtain their opinion on the remifentanil analgesia

arm_group.description: Parturients after induction of remifentanyl analgesia during the delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parturients during the delivery
- administered remifentanil analgesia
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- informed consent not signed
- missing data about the analgetic method a analgetic efficacy

facility.name: KDAR - department of pediatrics anesthesia and resuscitation

clinical_study.keyword: Remifentanil, delivery, childbirth, analgesia, parturition, confinement
